title: Facebook Search now looks at all public posts Here’s how it affects your privacy
text:
Facebook Search now looks at all public posts: Here’s how it affects your privacy 
Pocket Lint Friday 23rd October, 2015 
Facebook overhauled its search bar last year so that it could be used to find not only your friends but also what your friends were saying. Well, it's just been updated to do much more: it can now look beyond your inner circle. 
The social network has been indexing all users' posts, enabling you to tap into its search bar, then type a phrase or keyword or name, and browse a flurry of posts directly related to what you're interested in finding. It's been doing this to your posts and your friends' posts for almost year. 
So, when you search for "Game of Thrones" or "World Series", Facebook S...
